snippet: The airline has been forced to cancel about 450 domestic and international flights, affecting almost 60,000 customers.
abstract: All Nippon Airways, enthusiastic Boeing customer now reeling from battery problems on its Dreamliner jets, says grounding of its 787 fleet hurt sales by about $15.4 million in January 2012, casting shadow on airline’s future earnings.
lead_paragraph: The airline has been forced to cancel about 450 domestic and international flights, affecting almost 60,000 customers.

headline.seo: All Nippon Says Grounding of 787s Has Cost About $15 Million
headline.main: All Nippon Says Grounding of 787s Has Cost $15 Million
headline.print_headline: All Nippon Says Grounding Of 787s Has Cost $15 Million
